extracted_sections.summary: "AI-Based Public Fund Monitoring System" – IEEE, 2023: Demonstrated a 60% improvement in fraud detection through the use of machine learning and anomaly detection models in government finance systems.

sub_sections.refined_text: Limitations of Existing Systems: Current e-Governance portals and dashboards offer basic visualization and static reports but lack real-time anomaly detection, predictive insights.

extracted_sections.summary: Natural Language Processing (NLP): Analyzes fund reports, policies, and audit documents for Anomaly Detection (ML Models): Identifies irregular or suspicious expenditures using machine learning Predictive Analytics: Forecasts future fund requirements, delays, and risks using AI models.

extracted_sections.document: “AI Based Real Time Government Fund Monitoring, Expenditure”_.pdf
extracted_sections.section_title: The proposed AI-based fund monitoring system brings a transformative shift in how government
extracted_sections.summary: By integrating advanced technologies like machine learning, OCR, NLP, and predictive analytics, the system enables real-time monitoring of financial activities and detects anomalies with high accuracy.

sub_sections.refined_text: By integrating advanced technologies like machine learning, OCR, NLP, and predictive analytics, the system enables real-time monitoring of financial activities and detects anomalies with high accuracy.
sub_sections.document: “AI Based Real Time Government Fund Monitoring, Expenditure”_.pdf

sub_sections.refined_text: Furthermore, the incorporation of forecasting capabilities helps in identifying future fund requirements and misuse risks, allowing better planning and optimized allocation of resources.
sub_sections.document: “AI Based Real Time Government Fund Monitoring, Expenditure”_.pdf
